intro: Muretia transitoria, commonly known as the transient muretia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Muretia transitoria is often found as an epiphyte on trees, where it derives moisture and nutrients from the air and rain.
